messages.content: March 24, 2024  Today, I woke up at 6:00 a.m. and headed to Aluva for the NPTEL exam. During the exam, I met Amal, and we quickly became friends. It was an awesome experience; he's very friendly, and I found myself being friendly too. After the exam, which lasted an hour, I left the institution and went to fetch my bike. While doing so, I spotted [[Aji bro]] chatting with his friends. It is funny that this is a second time I am meeting him in an exam.I joined them for a conversation, and then we headed home together. On the way, I bought three juice for [[Aji bro]] and his friends.  Once back home, I spent a good chunk of time playing Far Cry 5. After indulging in some gaming, I dedicated a few hours to assisting juniors with their mini-project. Managed to complete about 50% of it. Later, I did some browsing on Google before calling it a night. Time to catch some Z's now.

Sounds like a solid day, Aswin! Made a new friend, bumped into Aji bro again (what are the odds?), treated them to juice, crushed some Far Cry 5, and still had time to help juniors with their project. That's a productive Sunday right there.

How'd the NPTEL exam go, by the way?
messages.reasoning:

I should respond naturally, acknowledging the day he had. It was a productive day - exam, made a new friend, ran into someone he knew, gamed, helped juniors with their project. Pretty solid day overall.

messages.content: Today was a tough day. I had to make a difficult decision regarding my friendship with Tony. Over time, his constant teasing and making fun of me became unbearable. It felt like our interactions were centered solely around finding faults or something to mock about me.  I reached a breaking point today and confronted him about it. Maybe I was a bit rash in my words, but I told him to stop talking to me. It wasn't an easy thing to do, as we've shared many good times together. However, I believe it's important to surround myself with people who uplift and support me, rather than bring me down.  I feel a mix of relief and sadness. Relief because I've taken a step towards preserving my mental well-being, and sadness because I've lost a friend. But sometimes, self-respect and peace of mind have to come first. I hope Tony understands my perspective, even if he doesn't agree with it.

That takes guts, man. Standing up for yourself isn't easy, especially with someone you've got history with. But you're right - constant negativity from a "friend" just drains you.

The mixed feelings are normal. You'll probably second-guess yourself sometimes, but don't. You did what you needed to do for your own peace.

How long had this been going on with Tony?
messages.reasoning:
Aswin is sharing something personal and emotional here. He had to end a friendship with Tony because of constant teasing and negativity. This is a tough situation, and he's feeling mixed emotions - relief and sadness.

I should respond in a supportive but not overly dramatic way. Keep it real and acknowledge what he did took courage. Don't be preachy or give unsolicited advice. Just be a good listener and validate his feelings.

The tone should be casual, direct, and empathetic - like a friend would respond.

messages.content: for almost 4months , now after 2yrs since college ended i am  not at all missing of him

That says it all right there. When you don't miss someone after two years, you know you made the right call.

Sometimes you don't realize how much someone was weighing you down until they're gone. Sounds like you're better off without that energy in your life.

- The incident with Tony happened (confronting him)
- 4 months of constant teasing before that
- Now it's been 2 years since college ended
- He doesn't miss Tony at all

This shows that his decision was the right one - time has proven that cutting ties was good for him. He's moved on and doesn't have regrets about it.

I should acknowledge that this confirms he made the right call. Sometimes you only realize how toxic something was after you've distanced yourself from it.
